params.taskDescription:
Fernando builds birdbaths <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>x</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(x)</annotation></semantics></math> and birdhouses <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>y</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(y)</annotation></semantics></math>. Fernando can make a total of 7 birdbaths and birdhouses per day. A birdbath costs $8 to make, while a birdhouse costs $6 to make. Fernando has $48 to spend on building materials for the day. When he sells them, Fernando makes $12 in profit on a birdbath and $9 in profit on a birdhouse.

params.taskDescription:
A fruit pie <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(p)</annotation></semantics></math> requires 12 ounces of fruit and 15 ounces of dough; a fruit tart <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>t</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(t)</annotation></semantics></math> requires 4 ounces of fruit and 3 ounces of dough. There are 72 ounces of fruit and 60 ounces of dough.

params.taskDescription:
One recipe for chocolate cake <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>c</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(c)</annotation></semantics></math> calls for 9 ounces of chocolate chips and 4 eggs; a recipe for dark chocolate cake <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>d</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(d)</annotation></semantics></math> requires 12 ounces of chocolate chips but only 3 eggs. There are 90 ounces of chocolate chips and 36 eggs.

params.taskDescription:
To build an outdoor bench <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(b)</annotation></semantics></math>, a carpenter needs 10 pieces of wood and 26 nails; to build an outdoor chair <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>c</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(c)</annotation></semantics></math>, the carpenter need 8 pieces of wood and 33 nails. There are 92 pieces of wood and 286 nails.

questionSetStimulus: For the following exercises, write the constraint inequalities. The variables to use are given in parentheses.
